contraindications.note: CONTRAINDICATED in pregnancy and children <8 years (tooth discoloration, bone growth effects).

pcn_allergy.note: Safe with PCN allergy. Excellent alternative for many PCN-allergic patients.

severe_pcn_allergy.note: Safe alternative for severe PCN allergy (no cross-reactivity)

pregnancy_notes: CONTRAINDICATED in pregnancy (all trimesters). Causes tooth discoloration and inhibits bone growth in fetus.

renal_adjustment.note: NO renal dose adjustment needed. Primarily fecal excretion. Safe in renal failure.

ssti_mrsa.note: First-line for MRSA skin infections (outpatient). Alternative to TMP/SMX.

bite_wound.note: Alternative for bite wounds with PCN allergy (combine with metronidazole for anaerobes)

tick_borne.note: First-line for Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever, Lyme disease, ehrlichiosis, anaplasmosis

pelvic_inflammatory_disease.note: Outpatient PID regimen (with ceftriaxone 500 mg IM × 1)

chlamydia.note: First-line for Chlamydia trachomatis (alternative: azithromycin 1 g × 1)

malaria_prophylaxis.duration: Start 1-2 days before travel, continue 4 weeks after

pediatric.note: CONTRAINDICATED in children <8 years (tooth discoloration). If >8 years and >45 kg: adult dose.

spectrum.gram_positive: Good (MSSA, some MRSA - check local susceptibility)

notes: ⚠️ CONTRAINDICATED in pregnancy and children <8 years
First-line for MRSA SSTI (alternative to TMP/SMX)
First-line for tick-borne diseases (Lyme, RMSF, ehrlichiosis)
NO renal dose adjustment needed (safe in renal failure)
⚠️ PHOTOSENSITIVITY - warn patients to use sunscreen
Take with food to reduce nausea
Take with full glass of water, remain upright 30 min (prevent esophagitis)
AVOID: antacids, calcium, iron, zinc within 2 hours (chelation)
May reduce oral contraceptive effectiveness (use backup method)
evidence: IDSA SSTI Guidelines 2014 - first-line for CA-MRSA
